ground_truth: In response to that, Charlie does the only thing someone can do when told such a thing: she laughs. At this, Charlie goes white, the realization hitting her, and Michael nods. Charlie sways on her feet, and Jeep rests a hand on her shoulder, steadying her. With a clank, Michael re-arms his weapon and turns to the group with finality, while Percy looks at him skeptically. Kyle looks at Percy with fear in his eyes, then turns back to the darkness and the evil that surrounds them. Bob plays with his trusty zippo with one hand and grills up some steaks with the other, pausing to take a slug from a can of beer. Sandra sits at the counter across from him, staring at a prescription bottle tipped in front of her, pills spread around. Bob glances over, sees the devastation in her eyes, pulls another can of beer from underneath the counter, pops it, and places it in front of her. She looks up at him, smiles weakly, and takes a sip. The moment the words leave her mouth, the grief hits her again. Meanwhile, in a booth across the diner, Audrey is fiddling with Percy's old radio. At the front of the diner, Jeep silently helps Michael nail broken table planks across the shattered window, eyeing the strange tattoos running down Michael's arms and the two jagged wounds visible above his shirt line. Michael considers the question a beat, then drives the last nail into place, securing the window. He pauses a beat as if unsure how much to say, then heads for the roof, leaving Jeep to stare after him, deep in thought. The faintest glint of sunlight shines through the dark red dusty haze as Michael searches the horizon in front of the diner for movement. On the other side of the roof, Bob keeps watch, struggling to stay awake as his eyes droop closed. Sandra awakens with a start, spins around, and searches for who is calling her name. She turns to face the back door, which is blocked by a desk, and slowly approaches it. Sandra is stricken and notices the transom window above the door. She climbs onto the desk and stretches up until she can see out, finding Howard, her husband, there. His skin is covered with horrible black boils that are breathing, and Sandra goes slack with horror. She struggles against him, throwing a wild elbow that tags Kyle in the face, causing Kyle to go down just as Sandra is about to open the door when Audrey pounces on her. Percy springs up as Howard is nailed to the upside-down cross below, and Audrey rushes into the room to stop her mother, Sandra, who then slaps Audrey hard, causing Audrey to stumble over Kyle and hit the floor.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: In reply to that, Charlie performs the sole action anyone can perform when informed of such a matter: she chuckles. At this, Charlie turns pale, the understanding striking her, and Michael gestures. Charlie totters on her legs, and Jeep places a palm on her shoulder, stabilizing her. With a clang, Michael re-equips his firearm and rotates to the assembly with conclusiveness, while Percy observes him suspiciously. Kyle peers at Percy with terror in his eyes, then rotates back to the obscurity and the malevolence that encircles them. Bob fiddles with his dependable lighter with one palm and sears some chops with the other, pausing to take a swig from a can of ale. Sandra perches at the counter across from him, gazing at a medicine vial tilted in front of her, capsules scattered around. Bob glances over, notices the ruin in her eyes, retrieves another can of ale from beneath the counter, opens it, and positions it in front of her. She gazes up at him, grins faintly, and takes a sip. The instant the expressions exit her mouth, the sorrow strikes her again. Meanwhile, in a booth across the eatery, Audrey is tinkering with Percy's ancient radio. At the front of the eatery, Jeep quietly assists Michael in nailing fractured table boards across the broken window, observing the peculiar tattoos running down Michael's limbs and the two jagged lesions visible above his shirt line. Michael regards the inquiry a moment, then drives the last nail into position, securing the window. He hesitates a moment as if uncertain how much to reveal, then heads for the roof, leaving Jeep to gaze after him, immersed in thought. The faintest shimmer of sunshine gleams through the dim crimson dusty mist as Michael scans the horizon in front of the eatery for movement. On the opposite side of the roof, Bob keeps vigil, battling to remain conscious as his eyes droop shut. Sandra awakens with a jolt, spins around, and searches for who is calling her name. She turns to confront the rear entrance, which is obstructed by a desk, and gradually approaches it. Sandra is stunned and notices the transom pane above the entrance. She climbs onto the desk and extends up until she can see out, finding Howard, her spouse, there. His skin is covered with dreadful black pustules that are pulsating, and Sandra goes limp with terror. She struggles against him, throwing a wild elbow that tags Kyle in the visage, causing Kyle to collapse just as Sandra is about to unlatch the entrance when Audrey springs on her. Percy leaps up as Howard is affixed to the inverted cross below, and Audrey dashes into the chamber to stop her mother, Sandra, who then strikes Audrey firmly, causing Audrey to stumble over Kyle and hit the ground.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: In response to that, the only thing that can be done by someone when told such a thing is done by Charlie: she laughs. At this, Charlie is turned white by the realization hitting her, and Michael nods. Charlie is swayed on her feet, and a hand is rested on her shoulder by Jeep, steadying her. With a clank, the weapon is re-armed by Michael, and he turns to the group with finality, while Percy looks at him skeptically. Fear is seen in Kyle's eyes as he looks at Percy, then he turns back to the darkness and the evil that surrounds them. The trusty zippo is played with by Bob with one hand, and some steaks are grilled up by him with the other, pausing to take a slug from a can of beer. Sandra sits at the counter across from him, staring at a prescription bottle tipped in front of her, pills spread around. Bob glances over, sees the devastation in her eyes, pulls another can of beer from underneath the counter, pops it, and places it in front of her. She looks up at him, smiles weakly, and takes a sip. The moment the words leave her mouth, she is hit by grief again. Meanwhile, in a booth across the diner, Percy's old radio is fiddled with by Audrey. At the front of the diner, broken table planks are nailed across the shattered window by Jeep, silently helping Michael, while eyeing the strange tattoos running down Michael's arms and the two jagged wounds visible above his shirt line. Michael considers the question a beat, then drives the last nail into place, securing the window. He pauses a beat as if unsure how much to say, then heads for the roof, leaving Jeep to stare after him, deep in thought. The faintest glint of sunlight shines through the dark red dusty haze as the horizon in front of the diner is searched by Michael for movement. On the other side of the roof, Bob keeps watch, struggling to stay awake as his eyes droop closed. With a start, Sandra awakens, spins around, and searches for who is calling her name. She turns to face the back door, which a desk blocks, and slowly approaches it. Sandra is stricken and notices the transom window above the door. The desk is climbed onto by her, and she stretches up until out the window is seen by her, finding Howard, her husband, there. His skin is covered with horrible black boils that are breathing, and horror turns Sandra slack. She struggles against him, throwing a wild elbow that tags Kyle in the face, causing Kyle to go down just as Sandra is about to open the door when Audrey pounces on her. Percy springs up as Howard is nailed to the upside-down cross below, and Audrey rushes into the room to stop her mother, Sandra, who then slaps Audrey hard, causing Audrey to stumble over Kyle and hit the floor.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Charlie laughs in response, but then goes pale as realization hits her, and Michael nods. Charlie sways, and Jeep steadies her with a hand on her shoulder. Michael re-arms his weapon with a clank and turns to the group decisively, while Percy looks skeptical. Kyle, fearful, turns back to the surrounding darkness and evil. Bob juggles his trusty zippo and grills steaks, pausing to sip beer. Sandra sits across from him, staring at a spilled prescription bottle. Bob notices her devastation, offers her a beer, and she smiles weakly, taking a sip. Grief hits her again as she speaks. Meanwhile, Audrey fiddles with Percy's old radio in a booth. At the diner's front, Jeep helps Michael nail planks over a shattered window, eyeing Michael's tattoos and wounds. Michael pauses, then secures the window and heads to the roof, leaving Jeep deep in thought. Sunlight glints through the dusty haze as Michael scans the horizon. Bob struggles to stay awake on the roof. Sandra awakens, hears her name, and approaches the blocked back door. She climbs to see her husband Howard, covered in breathing black boils, and is horrified. She struggles, accidentally hitting Kyle, who falls. As Sandra is about to open the door, Audrey stops her. Percy jumps up as Howard is nailed to an upside-down cross, and Audrey rushes in, but Sandra slaps her, causing Audrey to stumble over Kyle and fall.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Charlie laughs at the situation, then turns pale as realization hits her, with Michael nodding. She sways, and Jeep steadies her. Michael re-arms his weapon and turns to the group, while Percy looks skeptically. Kyle, fearful, turns to the surrounding darkness. Bob juggles his zippo and grills steaks, sipping beer. Sandra, at the counter, stares at scattered pills. Bob notices her devastation, offers her a beer, and she smiles weakly, sipping it. Grief hits her again. Audrey fiddles with Percy's radio. Jeep helps Michael nail planks over a window, noticing Michael's tattoos and wounds. Michael secures the window, hesitates, then heads to the roof. Sunlight glints through the haze as Michael scans the horizon. Bob struggles to stay awake on the roof. Sandra awakens, hears her name, and approaches the blocked back door. She sees her husband Howard, covered in black boils, through the transom window. Horrified, she struggles, accidentally hitting Kyle. As she opens the door, Audrey stops her. Percy reacts as Howard is nailed to a cross, and Audrey rushes to stop Sandra, who slaps Audrey, causing her to stumble over Kyle.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: In response to that unexpected statement, Charlie does the only thing that seems natural when confronted with such a revelation: she bursts into laughter. However, as the gravity of the situation dawns on her, Charlie's face turns pale, the realization hitting her hard, and Michael gives a knowing nod. Charlie begins to sway unsteadily on her feet, and Jeep, noticing her distress, places a steadying hand on her shoulder to support her. With a metallic clank, Michael re-arms his weapon, turning to face the group with a sense of finality, while Percy regards him with a skeptical expression. Kyle, filled with fear, glances at Percy, then shifts his gaze back to the encroaching darkness and the malevolent presence that surrounds them. Meanwhile, Bob is multitasking, skillfully playing with his trusty zippo lighter in one hand while grilling up some steaks with the other. He pauses momentarily to take a swig from a can of beer. Sandra, seated at the counter across from him, is fixated on a prescription bottle tipped over in front of her, with pills scattered around. Bob notices the devastation in her eyes, retrieves another can of beer from beneath the counter, opens it, and places it in front of her. She looks up at him, offering a weak smile, and takes a sip. As soon as the words leave her mouth, the weight of her grief crashes over her once more. Meanwhile, in a booth across the diner, Audrey is busy fiddling with Percy's old radio. At the front of the diner, Jeep is quietly assisting Michael in nailing broken table planks across the shattered window, all the while observing the strange tattoos that snake down Michael's arms and the two jagged wounds visible above his shirt line. Michael pauses for a moment, considering the question, then drives the last nail into place, securing the window. He hesitates briefly, as if unsure how much to reveal, then heads for the roof, leaving Jeep to watch him go, lost in thought. The faintest glimmer of sunlight pierces through the dark red dusty haze as Michael scans the horizon in front of the diner for any signs of movement. On the opposite side of the roof, Bob is keeping watch, struggling to stay awake as his eyelids droop with fatigue. Sandra awakens with a start, spinning around to search for the source of the voice calling her name. She turns to face the back door, which is blocked by a desk, and cautiously approaches it. Stricken with fear, Sandra notices the transom window above the door. She climbs onto the desk, stretching up until she can peer out, only to find Howard, her husband, standing there. His skin is grotesquely covered with horrible black boils that seem to be breathing, and Sandra is overcome with horror, going slack with shock. She struggles against him, throwing a wild elbow that accidentally strikes Kyle in the face, causing him to fall just as Sandra is about to open the door. At that moment, Audrey pounces on her. Percy springs into action as Howard is nailed to the upside-down cross below, and Audrey rushes into the room to stop her mother, Sandra, who then slaps Audrey hard, causing her to stumble over Kyle and hit the floor.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: In response to that unexpected and startling statement, Charlie does the only thing that seems to come naturally to her when confronted with such a surprising revelation: she bursts into a fit of laughter. However, as the full gravity and seriousness of the situation begin to dawn on her, Charlie's face gradually turns pale, the realization hitting her with a jarring impact. Michael gives a knowing nod, acknowledging the situation. Charlie starts to sway unsteadily on her feet, and Jeep, noticing her obvious distress and unease, gently places a steadying hand on her shoulder to offer support. With a loud metallic clank, Michael re-arms his weapon, turning back to face the rest of the group with a sense of finality. Percy watches him with a skeptical and questioning expression. Kyle, filled with an overwhelming sense of fear, glances at Percy, then quickly shifts his gaze back to the encroaching darkness and the malevolent presence that seems to surround them. Meanwhile, Bob is busy multitasking, skillfully playing with his trusty zippo lighter in one hand while expertly grilling up some steaks with the other. He pauses momentarily to take a long swig from a can of beer. Sandra, who is seated at the counter across from him, is fixated on a prescription bottle that is tipped over in front of her, with pills scattered around. Bob notices the devastation and despair in her eyes, retrieves another can of beer from beneath the counter, opens it, and places it in front of her. She looks up at him, offering a weak and tentative smile, and takes a sip. As soon as the words leave her mouth, the weight of her grief crashes over her once more like a tidal wave. Meanwhile, in a booth across the diner, Audrey is busy fiddling and tinkering with Percy's old radio. At the front of the diner, Jeep is quietly assisting Michael in nailing broken table planks across the shattered window, all the while observing the strange tattoos that snake down Michael's arms and the two jagged wounds that are visible above his shirtline. Michael pauses for a moment, considering the question, then drives the last nail into place, securely fastening the window. He hesitates briefly, as if unsure how much he should reveal, then decides to head for the roof, leaving Jeep to watch him go, lost in thought. The faintest and dimmest glimmer of sunlight pierces through the dark red dusty haze as Michael scans the horizon in front of the diner for any signs of movement. On the opposite side of the roof, Bob is keeping watch, struggling to stay awake as his eyelids droop with fatigue. Sandra awakens with a start, spinning around frantically to search for the source of the voice calling her name. She turns to face the back door, which is blocked by a desk, and cautiously approaches it. Stricken with fear, Sandra notices the transom window above the door. She climbs onto the desk, stretching up until she can peer out, only to find Howard, her husband, standing there. His skin is grotesquely covered with horrible, black boils that seem to be breathing, and Sandra is overcome with horror, going slack with shock. She struggles against him, throwing a wild elbow that accidentally strikes Kyle in the face, causing him to fall just as Sandra is about to open the door. At that critical moment, Audrey pounces on her. Percy springs into action as Howard is nailed to the upside-down cross below, and Audrey rushes into the room to stop her mother, Sandra, who then slaps Audrey hard, causing her to stumble over Kyle and hit the floor with a thud.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: In response to the unsettling statement, Charlie does the only thing someone can do when confronted with such a situation: she bursts into laughter, a reaction that seems almost involuntary. As the laughter escapes her lips, a sudden change comes over her; Charlie's face drains of color, going white as the realization of the situation hits her with full force. Observing this, Michael gives a nod, acknowledging the gravity of the moment. Charlie, now unsteady, sways on her feet, prompting Jeep to step in and place a reassuring hand on her shoulder, providing the support she needs to regain her balance. Meanwhile, with a metallic clank, Michael re-arms his weapon, signaling his readiness and turning to face the group with a sense of finality. Percy, however, looks at him with skepticism, unsure of the situation. Kyle, witnessing this exchange, glances at Percy with fear evident in his eyes, then shifts his gaze back to the encroaching darkness and the malevolent presence that surrounds them. In another part of the scene, Bob is multitasking, skillfully playing with his trusty zippo lighter in one hand while grilling steaks with the other. He pauses momentarily to take a swig from a can of beer, savoring the moment. Across from him, Sandra sits at the counter, her attention fixed on a prescription bottle that lies tipped over in front of her, its contents—pills—scattered around. Bob notices the devastation reflected in her eyes, prompting him to reach under the counter for another can of beer, which he opens and places in front of her as a gesture of comfort. Sandra looks up at him, offering a weak smile of gratitude before taking a sip. However, as soon as she speaks, the weight of her grief crashes over her once more. Meanwhile, in a booth across the diner, Audrey is occupied with fiddling with Percy's old radio, trying to make it work. At the front of the diner, Jeep is silently assisting Michael in nailing broken table planks across the shattered window, all the while observing the strange tattoos that snake down Michael's arms and the two jagged wounds that are visible above his shirt line. Michael takes a moment to consider a question, then decisively drives the last nail into place, securing the window. He hesitates briefly, as if contemplating how much to reveal, before heading for the roof, leaving Jeep to watch him go, lost in thought. As Michael reaches the roof, the faintest glint of sunlight pierces through the dark red dusty haze, and he scans the horizon in front of the diner for any signs of movement. On the opposite side of the roof, Bob is on watch, struggling to stay awake as his eyelids grow heavy and begin to close. Inside, Sandra awakens with a start, her senses on high alert as she spins around, searching for the source of the voice calling her name. Her attention is drawn to the back door, which is obstructed by a desk, and she cautiously approaches it. Stricken by what she sees, Sandra notices the transom window above the door. Determined to get a better view, she climbs onto the desk and stretches upward until she can peer outside, where she finds her husband, Howard, standing there. His skin is grotesquely covered with horrible black boils that seem to be breathing, and Sandra is overcome with horror, going slack at the sight. In a desperate struggle, she fights against him, throwing a wild elbow that inadvertently strikes Kyle in the face, causing him to fall just as Sandra is about to open the door. At that critical moment, Audrey leaps into action, pouncing on Sandra to prevent her from making a grave mistake. Percy springs into action as well, reacting to the chaos as Howard is nailed to the upside-down cross below. Audrey rushes into the room, determined to stop her mother, Sandra, who, in a moment of panic, slaps Audrey hard, causing her to stumble over Kyle and hit the floor.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Charlie laughs in response to the shocking news, but quickly turns pale as the realization hits her, prompting Michael to nod. As Charlie sways, Jeep steadies her with a hand on her shoulder. Michael re-arms his weapon with a clank and turns to the group decisively, while Percy looks on skeptically. Kyle, filled with fear, glances at Percy before turning back to the surrounding darkness and evil. Meanwhile, Bob multitasks by playing with his zippo and grilling steaks, pausing to drink from a beer can. Sandra, sitting across from him, stares at a prescription bottle and scattered pills. Noticing her distress, Bob offers her another beer, which she accepts with a weak smile. Grief overtakes her again as she speaks. Across the diner, Audrey tinkers with Percy's old radio. At the front, Jeep assists Michael in nailing table planks over a shattered window, observing Michael's tattoos and wounds. After considering a question, Michael secures the window and heads to the roof, leaving Jeep deep in thought. On the roof, Michael scans the horizon for movement as sunlight filters through the dusty haze, while Bob struggles to stay awake on the other side. Inside, Sandra awakens abruptly and searches for the source of her name being called. She approaches the blocked back door, climbs onto a desk, and peers through the transom window to find her husband, Howard, covered in breathing black boils. Horrified, she struggles against him, accidentally elbowing Kyle in the face. As Sandra is about to open the door, Audrey intervenes, and Percy reacts as Howard is nailed to an upside-down cross. Audrey rushes to stop Sandra, who slaps her, causing Audrey to stumble over Kyle and fall.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: In response to that, Charlie does the only thing someone can do when told such a shocking thing: she laughs. At this, Charlie, who has always been known for her strong composure, goes white, the realization hitting her, and Michael nods, acknowledging the severity of the situation. Charlie sways on her feet, and Jeep, a reliable friend who grew up in this small town, rests a hand on her shoulder, steadying her. With a clank, Michael re-arms his weapon, a standard-issue firearm common among local enforcement, and turns to the group with finality, while Percy, known for his cautious nature, looks at him skeptically. Kyle, who had recently moved to the area and is unaccustomed to such intense situations, looks at Percy with fear in his eyes, then turns back to the darkness and the evil that surrounds them, a reminder of the legends frequently told by the town's elders. Bob plays with his trusty Zippo, an old lighter passed down from his grandfather, with one hand and grills up some steaks with the other, pausing to take a slug from a can of beer, a brand known for its strong taste. Sandra sits at the counter across from him, staring at a prescription bottle tipped in front of her, pills spread around, remnants of a challenging battle with depression. Bob glances over, sees the devastation in her eyes, pulls another can of beer from underneath the counter, pops it, and places it in front of her as a small comfort. She looks up at him, smiles weakly, and takes a sip. The moment the words leave her mouth, the grief hits her again, reminding her of the recent loss that still haunts her. Meanwhile, in a booth across the diner, Audrey is fiddling with Percy's old radio, a relic from the 1970s that still miraculously picks up signals. At the front of the diner, Jeep silently helps Michael nail broken table planks across the shattered window, performing a makeshift repair necessary for protection, eyeing the strange tattoos running down Michael's arms and the two jagged wounds visible above his shirt line, which seem to tell a story of hardship. Michael considers the question a beat, then drives the last nail into place, securing the window. He pauses a beat as if unsure how much to say, then heads for the roof, leaving Jeep to stare after him, deep in thought about Michael's mysterious past. The faintest glint of sunlight shines through the dark red dusty haze, a peculiar weather phenomenon often seen in this region, as Michael searches the horizon in front of the diner for movement. On the other side of the roof, Bob keeps watch, struggling to stay awake as his eyes droop closed, fighting the exhaustion brought on by long hours of vigilance. Sandra awakens with a start, spins around, and searches for who is calling her name in a voice that echoes memories. She turns to face the back door, which is blocked by a desk, and slowly approaches it, feeling a growing sense of dread. Sandra is stricken and notices the transom window above the door. She climbs onto the desk and stretches up until she can see out, finding Howard, her husband, there, transformed beyond recognition. His skin is covered with horrible black boils that are breathing, showcasing the effects of the mysterious disease plaguing the town, and Sandra goes slack with horror. She struggles against him, throwing a wild elbow that tags Kyle in the face, causing Kyle to go down just as Sandra is about to open the door when Audrey, desperate to stop her mother, pounces on her. Percy springs up as Howard is nailed to the upside-down cross below, a symbol of the chaos overtaking their once-peaceful community, and Audrey rushes into the room to stop her mother, Sandra, who then slaps Audrey hard, causing Audrey to stumble over Kyle and hit the floor.

Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. Michael considers the question a beat then drives the last nail into place securing the window. He pauses a beat as if unsure how much to say then heads for the roof leaving Jeep to stare after him deep in thought. The faintest glint of sunlight shines through the dark red dusty haze as Michael searches the horizon in front of the diner for movement. On the other side of the roof Bob keeps watch struggling to stay awake as his eyes droop closed. Sandra awakens with a start spins around and searches for who is calling her name. She turns to face the back door which is blocked by a desk and slowly approaches it. Sandra is stricken and notices the transom window above the door. She climbs onto the desk and stretches up until she can see out finding Howard her husband there. His skin is covered with horrible black boils that are breathing and Sandra goes slack with horror. She struggles against him throwing a wild elbow that tags Kyle in the face causing Kyle to go down just as Sandra is about to open the door. when Audrey pounces on her. Percy springs up as Howard is nailed to the upsidedown cross below and Audrey rushes into the room to stop her mother. Sandra who then slaps Audrey hard causing Audrey to stumble over Kyle and hit the floor.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: In response to that Charlie does the only thing someone can do when told such a thing. she laughs. At this Charlie goes white the realization hitting her and Michael nods. Charlie sways on her feet and Jeep rests a hand on her shoulder steadying her. With a clank Michael rearms his weapon and turns to the group with finality while Percy looks at him skeptically. Kyle looks at Percy with fear in his eyes then turns back to the darkness and the evil that surrounds them. Bob plays with his trusty zippo with one hand and grills up some steaks with the other pausing to take a slug from a can of beer. She climbs onto the desk and stretches up until she can see out finding Howard her husband there. His skin is covered with horrible black boils that are breathing and Sandra goes slack with horror. She struggles against him throwing a wild elbow that tags Kyle in the face causing Kyle to go down just as Sandra is about to open the door. when Audrey pounces on her. Percy springs up as Howard is nailed to the upsidedown cross below and Audrey rushes into the room to stop her mother. Sandra who then slaps Audrey hard causing Audrey to stumble over Kyle and hit the floor.

Percy springs up as Howard is nailed to the upsidedown cross below and Audrey rushes into the room to stop her mother. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: In reply to that, Oliver performs the sole action anyone might undertake when given such news: he whistles. Following this, Oliver turns crimson, the comprehension engulfing him, and Fiona salutes. Oliver sways on his toes, and Falcon places an ear on his elbow, calming him. With a clang, Fiona re-aligns her toolbox and pivots to the gathering with certainty, while Max regards her suspiciously. Danny gazes at Max with confidence in his grin, then pivots back to the illumination and the goodness that envelops them. Ted fiddles with his rusty harmonica with one toe and concocts some omelets with the other, pausing to gnaw on a slice of pie. Monica reclines at the table adjacent to him, peering at a crumpled map laid before her, crayons scattered around. Ted peers over, notices the excitement in her grin, retrieves another slice of pie from within the cabinet, slices it, and positions it before her. She beams at him, chuckles lightly, and nibbles a corner. The instant the syllables hit her ears, the joy overwhelms her once more. Meanwhile, in a tent across the park, Emily is tinkering with Max's vintage lantern. At the back of the park, Falcon quietly aids Fiona in stacking broken chair legs against the shattered gate, admiring the intricate paintings running down Fiona's sleeves and the two tiny tattoos visible above her collar. Fiona ponders the inquiry a moment, then attaches the final branch in place, reinforcing the gate. She hesitates a moment as if contemplating how much to reveal, then ventures to the attic, leaving Falcon to gaze after her, lost in contemplation. The faintest glimmer of moonlight filters through the bright blue misty fog as Fiona scans the horizon beyond the park for signs of life. On the opposite side of the attic, Ted keeps vigil, struggling to remain alert as his ears droop shut. Monica jolts awake with a gasp, twirls around, and searches for whoever is whistling her tune. She turns to confront the front gate, which is obstructed by a bookshelf, and carefully advances toward it. Monica is stunned and observes the skylight window above the gate. She climbs onto the bookshelf and stretches downward until she can peek out, spotting Leo, her brother, there. His skin is covered with magnificent white feathers that are singing, and Monica goes stiff with awe. She wrestles against them, tossing a wayward knee that taps Danny in the shoulder, causing Danny to topple just as Monica prepares to unlock the gate when Emily leaps upon her. Max leaps up as Leo is pinned to the upright ladder below, and Emily dashes into the clearing to halt her cousin, Monica, who then embraces Emily warmly, causing Emily to trip over Danny and meet the floor.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Charlie laughs until realization hits her, and Michael confirms her fears, as Jeep steadies her. Michael re-arms his weapon decisively, despite Percy's skepticism. Kyle, fearful, turns back to the darkness. Meanwhile, Bob grills steaks, drinks beer, and offers Sandra another can as she stares at her spilled pills. Audrey tinkers with Percy's old radio. Jeep silently helps Michael secure a shattered window, observing Michael's strange tattoos and wounds. Michael briefly pauses before heading to the roof, leaving Jeep in thought. On the roof, Michael scans the horizon, while Bob struggles to stay awake. Sandra, startled awake, approaches the back door and climbs up to see her husband Howard, covered in black boils, through the transom window. In terror, Sandra lashes out, hitting Kyle by accident as she's stopped from opening the door by Audrey. Sandra slaps Audrey, causing her to fall, while Percy stands as Howard is nailed to an upside-down cross.
